topics.body:
And since I'm not really paying attention to the thread cause I'm doing shit here's a couple fun facts:
The way to survive getting hit by vehicles is to tuck and roll on your side.  Your arms and legs can take far more damage than your head.  Considering I've been hit by speeding vehicles twice it saved my from any broken bones.

If you fall down stairs tuck and roll sideways.

If you're falling from a high height tuck and roll sideways while guarding your head.  Shattered legs and arms are better than a shattered spine.  Don't try to be stylish; stylish = dead.


If you're getting tasered you contract your muscles as hard as you can.  Tasers work by causing your muscles to rapidly twitch and untwitch.  Nothing says "fuck your shit" like grabbing the taser from them.


Hyperventilating before holding your breath can drastically improve how long you can hold your breath by minutes.


Milk can rinse out pepper spray.


If you ever get impaled for the love of god don't pull it out.  Whatever has impaled you is like a cork for your blood; if you pull it out you're going to bleed much faster.


Radioactive fallout seeps into fabrics; if there's ever a nuclear winter get a latex/rubber fetish.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

Yeah, I'm surprised about that myself.

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559361a3636872382d000dba#post_559361a3636872382d000dba
Also don't drink alcohol when you have a injury.  Alcohol thins your blood.  It makes for a good wound disinfectant, but don't drink it.

Especially don't drink alcohol when you have a concussion.


Also the human body can handle moderately irradiated water, but if you have radiation poisoning you needs lots and lots of clean water and wine.  If you have lethal radiation poisoning it won't do anything, but fuck tons of water will slow down the damage.

[bq="And Brother I Hurt People"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559363dd6368722d390006b0#post_559363dd6368722d390006b0

I imagine that would stifle a wound that needs oxygen?[/bq]
